alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Edgefield (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following areas, in east central Georgia, southeast Columbia and Richmond Counties. In central South Carolina, southwest Aiken and southeast Edgefield Counties. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Augusta, Grovetown, Fort Gordon, Augusta, Martinez, Clearwater, Belvedere, Hephzibah, South Augusta, Glendale, Daniel Field, Augusta Mall, Summerville, Midtown, Augusta Regional Airport, Augusta National Golf Club, Village Plaza Shopping Center, Burnettown, Blythe and Richmond County Recreation Center. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 16 and 23. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 7. Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 194 and 201. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 15. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
